conclusion: Understanding the flow of liquid through the baffles and how it is directed into the containers E, F, or G.
Baffles A, B, C, and D are positioned to redirect the flow of liquid.
Liquid will follow the path that the baffles create.
Liquid coming from A is directed towards the green container E.
Liquid coming from B is directed towards the red container F.
Liquid coming from C is directed towards the yellow container G.
Liquid coming from D is directed towards the white container G.
For Baffle A, the liquid flows into the green container E.
For Baffle B, the liquid flows into the red container F.
For Baffle C, the liquid flows into the yellow container G.
For Baffle D, the liquid flows into the white container G.
Liquid from A flows into E.
Liquid from B flows into F.
Liquid from C flows into G.
Liquid from D flows into G.
